<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="endovex-s-triangle">Endovex's triangle<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#endovex-s-triangle" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>An imaginary equilateral triangle formed by the three bipolar electrodes (i, ii and iii). The heads of the triangle are the points of attachment of the unipolar leads aVPI, aVI, and aVF, with the assumption that the heart lies in the center of this triangle.</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-bb562f7a.jpeg" alt="img-227.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>It is well known in electricity that "in an equilateral triangle, with a source of electricity in the center, the summation of potentials at the heads of the triangle <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x = \Delta V</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span class="mord">Δ</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">V</span></span></span></span></span>".</li>
</ul>
<p>Taking: Endovex's triangle: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>P</mi><mi>I</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>I</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>F</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>P</mi><mi>I</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">(aVPI + aVI, + aVF + aVPI) = 0 + 8 = 8</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord">+</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">F</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">0</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span></span></span></span></span></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Endovex's triangle is used to determine the cardiac axis (i.e. the orientation of the heart relative to the horizontal plane), which lies normally between the angles: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>30.6</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>60</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">30.6 \pm 60</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">30.6</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">±</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">60</span></span></span></span></span> degrees (or up to <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>110</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">+110</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">+</span><span class="mord">110</span></span></span></span></span>).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Left ventricular hypertrophy deviates the axis to the left of -30 whereas right ventricular hypertrophy deviates the heart to the right of 110 degrees.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="importance-of-the-ecg">Importance of the ECG<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#importance-of-the-ecg" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>The ECG is used to:</li>
<li>Calculate the heart rate</li>
<li>Assess the size of the heart</li>
<li>Diagnose diseases of the heart (e.g. ischemic heart disease (IHD), myocardial infarction, pericardial effusion ...)</li>
<li>Diagnose arrhythmias</li>
<li>Diagnose electrolyte disturbances (e.g. hyper or hypokalaemia)</li>
</ul>
<p>213
The issue of medical physiology 1st edition</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="endovex-s-triangle">Endovex's triangle<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#endovex-s-triangle" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>An imaginary equilateral triangle formed by the three bipolar electrodes (i, ii and iii). The heads of the triangle are the points of attachment of the unipolar leads aVPI, aVI, and aVF, with the assumption that the heart lies in the center of this triangle.</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-5c9ea675.jpeg" alt="img-228.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>It is well known in electricity that "in an equilateral triangle, with a source of electricity in the center, the summation of potentials at the heads of the triangle <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x = \Delta V</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span class="mord">Δ</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">V</span></span></span></span></span>".</li>
</ul>
<p>Taking: Endovex's triangle: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>P</mi><mi>I</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>I</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>F</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>P</mi><mi>I</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">(aVPI + aVI, + aVF + aVPI) = 0 + 8 = 8</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord">+</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">F</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">0</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span></span></span></span></span></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Endovex's triangle is used to determine the cardiac axis (i.e. the orientation of the heart relative to the horizontal plane), which lies normally between the angles: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>30.6</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>60</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">30.6 \pm 60</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">30.6</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">±</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">60</span></span></span></span></span> degrees (or up to <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>110</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">+110</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">+</span><span class="mord">110</span></span></span></span></span>).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Left ventricular hypertrophy deviates the axis to the left of -30 whereas right ventricular hypertrophy deviates the heart to the right of 110 degrees.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="importance-of-the-ecg">Importance of the ECG<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#importance-of-the-ecg" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>The ECG is used to:</li>
<li>Calculate the heart rate</li>
<li>Assess the size of the heart</li>
<li>Diagnose diseases of the heart (e.g. ischemic heart disease (IHD), myocardial infarction, pericardial effusion ...)</li>
<li>Diagnose arrhythmias</li>
<li>Diagnose electrolyte disturbances (e.g. hyper or hypokalaemia)</li>
</ul>
<p>214
The issue of medical physiology 1st edition</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="endovex-s-triangle">Endovex's triangle<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#endovex-s-triangle" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>An imaginary equilateral triangle formed by the three bipolar electrodes (i, ii and iii). The heads of the triangle are the points of attachment of the unipolar leads aVPI, aVI, and aVF, with the assumption that the heart lies in the center of this triangle.</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-e895d214.jpeg" alt="img-229.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>It is well known in electricity that "in an equilateral triangle, with a source of electricity in the center, the summation of potentials at the heads of the triangle <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x = \Delta V</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span class="mord">Δ</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">V</span></span></span></span></span>".</li>
</ul>
<p>Taking: Endovex's triangle: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>P</mi><mi>I</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>I</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>F</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>P</mi><mi>I</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">(aVPI + aVI, + aVF + aVPI) = 0 + 8 = 8</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord">+</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">F</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">aV</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">0</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">8</span></span></span></span></span></p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Endovex's triangle is used to determine the cardiac axis (i.e. the orientation of the heart relative to the horizontal plane), which lies normally between the angles: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>30.6</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>60</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">30.6 \pm 60</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">30.6</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">±</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">60</span></span></span></span></span> degrees (or up to <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>110</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">+110</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">+</span><span class="mord">110</span></span></span></span></span>).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Left ventricular hypertrophy deviates the axis to the left of -30 whereas right ventricular hypertrophy deviates the heart to the right of 110 degrees.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="importance-of-the-ecg">Importance of the ECG<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#importance-of-the-ecg" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>The ECG is used to:</li>
<li>Calculate the heart rate</li>
<li>Assess the size of the heart</li>
<li>Diagnose diseases of the heart (e.g. ischemic heart disease (IHD), myocardial infarction, pericardial effusion ...)</li>
<li>Diagnose arrhythmias</li>
<li>Diagnose electrolyte disturbances (e.g. hyper or hypokalaemia)</li>
</ul>
<p>September 2009</p>
<p>The ECO does not detect the mechanical events in the heart (i.e. it does not show contraction or relaxation of the cardiac muscle). It only detects the electrical activity (i.e. depolarization and repolarization).</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="the-standard-ecg">The standard ECG<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-standard-ecg" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-normal-waves">The normal waves<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-normal-waves" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>If wave due to atrial depolarization</li>
<li>QRS complex due to ventricular depolarization</li>
<li>If wave due to ventricular repolarization</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-ad19b8c7.jpeg" alt="img-230.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>If wave due to papillary muscle repolarization; however, in sometimes, it may be absent from the ECG or may be present with other abnormal ECG signs indicating hypokalemia</li>
<li>Atrial repolarization is not shown in the ECG; it is obscured by the QRS complex.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-intervals">The intervals<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-intervals" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="pr-interval">PR interval<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#pr-interval" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>From beginning of P wave to the beginning of QRS complex.</li>
<li>Its duration (0.12-0.2 s) represents time taken for spreading of depolarization from the SA node to the ventricular septum (through AV node and bundle of HA).</li>
<li>Short PR interval indicates tachycardia (e.g. due to Wolf Parkinson White syndrome "WPA") whereas prolonged PR interval indicates 1st degree heart block (e.g. due to hypokalemia).</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="qrs-duration">QRS duration<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#qrs-duration" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>From beginning of "Q" wave to the end of "S" wave.</li>
</ul>
<p>November 2009</p>
<p>The ECG does not detect the mechanical events in the heart (i.e. it does not show contraction or relaxation of the cardiac muscle). It only detects the electrical activity (i.e. depolarization and repolarization).</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="the-standard-ecg">The standard ECG<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-standard-ecg" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-normal-waves">The normal waves<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-normal-waves" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>If wave due to atrial depolarization</li>
<li>QRS complex due to ventricular depolarization</li>
<li>If wave due to ventricular repolarization</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-2e0af7bf.jpeg" alt="img-231.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>If wave due to papillary muscle repolarization; however, in sometimes, it may be absent from the ECG or may be present with other abnormal ECG signs indicating hypokalemia</li>
<li>Atrial repolarization is not shown in the ECG; it is obscured by the QRS complex.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-intervals">The intervals<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-intervals" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="pr-interval">PR interval<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#pr-interval" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>From beginning of P wave to the beginning of QRS complex.</li>
<li>Its duration (0.12-0.2 s) represents time taken for spreading of depolarization from the SA node to the ventricular septum (through AV node and bundle of HA).</li>
<li>Short PR interval indicates tachycardia (e.g. due to Wolf Parkinson White syndrome "WPA") whereas prolonged PR interval indicates 1st degree heart block (e.g. due to hypokalemia).</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="qrs-duration">QRS duration<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#qrs-duration" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>From beginning of "Q" wave to the end of "S" wave.</li>
</ul>
<p>The event of medical physiology is not relevant.</p>
<p>December 2009</p>
<p>The ECG does not detect the mechanical events in the heart (i.e. it does not show contraction or relaxation of the cardiac muscle). It only detects the electrical activity (i.e. depolarization and repolarization).</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="the-standard-ecg">The standard ECG<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-standard-ecg" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-normal-waves">The normal waves<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-normal-waves" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>If wave due to atrial depolarization</li>
<li>QRS complex due to ventricular depolarization</li>
<li>If wave due to ventricular repolarization</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-bab99d77.jpeg" alt="img-232.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>If wave due to papillary muscle repolarization; however, in sometimes, it may be absent from the ECG or may be present with other abnormal ECG signs indicating hypokalemia</li>
<li>Atrial repolarization is not shown in the ECG; it is obscured by the QRS complex.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="the-intervals">The intervals<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#the-intervals" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="pr-interval">PR interval<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#pr-interval" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>From beginning of P wave to the beginning of QRS complex.</li>
<li>Its duration (0.12-0.2 s) represents time taken for spreading of depolarization from the SA node to the ventricular septum (through AV node and bundle of HA).</li>
<li>Short PR interval indicates tachycardia (e.g. due to Wolf Parkinson White syndrome "WPA") whereas prolonged PR interval indicates 1st degree heart block (e.g. due to hypokalemia).</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="qrs-duration">QRS duration<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#qrs-duration" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>From beginning of "Q" wave to the end of "S" wave.</li>
</ul>
<p>The event of medical physiology is not relevant.</p>
<ul>
<li>Its duration (&lt; 0.1 s) represents time taken for spreading of depolarization throughout both ventricles.</li>
<li>Prolonged QRS duration (described as broad complexes) indicates ventricular ischemia (ischemic heart disease "IHD")
&lt; QT interval</li>
<li>From beginning of "q" wave to the end of "I" wave.</li>
<li>Its duration (about 0.43 s) represents time of depolarization &amp; then repolarization of both ventricles.</li>
<li>Prolonged QT interval predisposes to ventricular arrhythmias.
&lt; ST segment</li>
<li>From the end of S wave to the beginning of T wave.</li>
<li>Equivalent to the plateau phase in action potential of the ventricular muscle; that's why it is affected by changes in <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathrm{Ca}^{2+}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8873em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">Ca</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8873em;"><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span><span class="mord mtight">+</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> ions (prolonged in hypocalcaemia short in hypercalcaemia).</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="calculation-of-the-heart-rate">Calculation of the heart rate<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#calculation-of-the-heart-rate" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>The heart rate from the ECG +
Paper speed (in mm/s) / duration of one ECG cycle (in mm)
The paper speed = 25 mm/s (unless the other value "50 mm/s" is used) whereas the duration of one ECG cycle is best taken as RR interval (in mm). This gives heart rate in beats per second.</li>
<li>To calculate the heart rate in beats per minute rather than per second, the "second" should be divided by 60, therefore the formula becomes:</li>
</ul>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>Heart&nbsp;rate&nbsp;(beat/min)</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>60</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mtext>RR&nbsp;interval&nbsp;(in&nbsp;mm)</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Heart rate (beat/min)} = 25 \times 60 / \text{RR interval (in mm)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Heart&nbsp;rate&nbsp;(beat/min)</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">25</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">60/</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">RR&nbsp;interval&nbsp;(in&nbsp;mm)</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<ul>
<li>Remember dimensions of the ECG paper:</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-9e1b72c0.jpeg" alt="img-233.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>Its duration (&lt; 0.1 s) represents time taken for spreading of depolarization throughout both ventricles.</li>
<li>Prolonged QRS duration (described as broad complexes) indicates ventricular ischemia (ischemic heart disease "IHD")
&lt; QT interval</li>
<li>From beginning of "q" wave to the end of "I" wave.</li>
<li>Its duration (about 0.43 s) represents time of depolarization &amp; then repolarization of both ventricles.</li>
<li>Prolonged QT interval predisposes to ventricular arrhythmias.
&lt; ST segment</li>
<li>From the end of S wave to the beginning of T wave.</li>
<li>Equivalent to the plateau phase in action potential of the ventricular muscle; that's why it is affected by changes in <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathrm{Ca}^{2+}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8873em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">Ca</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8873em;"><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span><span class="mord mtight">+</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> ions (prolonged in hypocalcaemia short in hypercalcaemia).</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="calculation-of-the-heart-rate">Calculation of the heart rate<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#calculation-of-the-heart-rate" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>The heart rate from the ECG +
Paper speed (in mm/s) / duration of one ECG cycle (in mm)</li>
<li>The paper speed = 25 mm/s (unless the other value "50 mm/s" is used) whereas the duration of one ECG cycle is best taken as RR interval (in mm). This gives heart rate in beats per second.
To calculate the heart rate in beats per minute rather than per second, the "second" should be divided by 60, therefore the formula becomes:</li>
</ul>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>Heart&nbsp;rate&nbsp;(beat/min)</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>60</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mtext>RR&nbsp;interval&nbsp;(in&nbsp;mm)</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Heart rate (beat/min)} = 25 \times 60 / \text{RR interval (in mm)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Heart&nbsp;rate&nbsp;(beat/min)</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">25</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">60/</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">RR&nbsp;interval&nbsp;(in&nbsp;mm)</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<ul>
<li>Remember dimensions of the ECG paper:</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-fef6addf.jpeg" alt="img-234.jpeg"></p>
<ul>
<li>Its duration (&lt; 0.1 s) represents time taken for spreading of depolarization throughout both ventricles.</li>
<li>Prolonged QRS duration (described as broad complexes) indicates ventricular ischemia (ischemic heart disease "IHD")
&lt; QT interval</li>
<li>From beginning of "q" wave to the end of "I" wave.</li>
<li>Its duration (about 0.43 s) represents time of depolarization &amp; then repolarization of both ventricles.</li>
<li>Prolonged QT interval predisposes to ventricular arrhythmias.
&lt; ST segment</li>
<li>From the end of S wave to the beginning of T wave.</li>
<li>Equivalent to the plateau phase in action potential of the ventricular muscle, that's why it is affected by changes in <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathrm{Ca}^{2+}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8873em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">Ca</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8873em;"><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span><span class="mord mtight">+</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> ions (prolonged in hypocalcaemia short in hypercalcaemia).</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="calculation-of-the-heart-rate">Calculation of the heart rate<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#calculation-of-the-heart-rate" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>The heart rate from the ECG +
Paper speed (in mm/s) / duration of one ECG cycle (in mm)</li>
<li>The paper speed = 25 mm/s (unless the other value "50 mm/s" is used) whereas the duration of one ECG cycle is best taken as RR interval (in mm). This gives heart rate in beats per second.</li>
<li>To calculate the heart rate in beats per minute rather than per second, the "second" should be divided by 60, therefore the formula becomes:</li>
</ul>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>Heart&nbsp;rate&nbsp;(beat/min)</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>60</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mtext>RR&nbsp;interval&nbsp;(in&nbsp;mm)</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Heart rate (beat/min)} = 25 \times 60 / \text{RR interval (in mm)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Heart&nbsp;rate&nbsp;(beat/min)</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">25</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">60/</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">RR&nbsp;interval&nbsp;(in&nbsp;mm)</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<ul>
<li>Remember dimensions of the ECG paper:</li>
</ul>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-fa4103a3.jpeg" alt="img-235.jpeg"></p>
<p>20
The text of medical technology® of science</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="appendix-eco">APPENDIX ECO<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#appendix-eco" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="special-areas-rhythm">Special areas rhythm<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#special-areas-rhythm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>The normal cardiac rhythm is a sinus rhythm (i.e. the pacemaker is the SA code).</li>
<li>Abnormal rhythms like nodal rhythm (pacemaker is AV node) or isoventricular rhythm (pacemaker is the ventricle) occur when the SA node is diseased or when there is complete block of conduction between atria and ventricles (3rd degree heart block).</li>
<li>Presence of normal P wave in the ECG indicates normal rhythm.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="sinus-arrhythmia">Sinus arrhythmia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sinus-arrhythmia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>This is a normal physiological condition in healthy children &amp; young adults. It depends on intact autonomic nervous system.</li>
<li>It is defined as change in heart rate with respiration (heart rate increases with expiration &amp; decreases with expiration). This variation in the heart rate is lost in patients with autonomic neuropathy.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="possible-explanations-for-the-sinus-arrhythmia">Possible explanations for the sinus arrhythmia:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#possible-explanations-for-the-sinus-arrhythmia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Aspiration = decreased intra-thoracic pressure = increased venous return = (aerologic reflex or effect (see below) = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Aspiration = discharge of inspiratory impulses from the respiratory center in the medulla = radiation of these impulses to the nearby cardiac center = increased sympathetic discharge from this center to the heart = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Inspiration = inflation of the lung = stimulation of stretch receptors in smooth muscle of bronchioles = inhibitory impulses pass through the vagus to the cardio-inhibitory center in the medulla = decreased parasympathetic supply to the heart = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Inspiration = increased venous return to the right side of the heart but decreased venous return to the left side = decreased cardiac output from the left side.</li>
</ol>
<p>21
The text of medical technology® of science</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="appendix-eco">APPENDIX ECO<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#appendix-eco" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="special-areas-rhythm">Special areas rhythm<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#special-areas-rhythm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>The normal cardiac rhythm is a sinus rhythm (i.e. the pacemaker is the SA code).</li>
<li>Abnormal rhythms like nodal rhythm (pacemaker is AV node) or isoventricular rhythm (pacemaker is the ventricle) occur when the SA node is diseased or when there is complete block of conduction between atria and ventricles (3rd degree heart block).</li>
<li>Presence of normal P wave in the ECG indicates normal rhythm.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="sinus-arrhythmia">Sinus arrhythmia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sinus-arrhythmia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>This is a normal physiological condition in healthy children &amp; young adults. It depends on intact autonomic nervous system.</li>
<li>It is defined as change in heart rate with respiration (heart rate increases with expiration &amp; decreases with expiration). This variation in the heart rate is lost in patients with autonomic neuropathy.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="possible-explanations-for-the-sinus-arrhythmia">Possible explanations for the sinus arrhythmia:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#possible-explanations-for-the-sinus-arrhythmia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Aspiration = decreased intra-thoracic pressure = increased venous return = (aerologic reflex or effect (see below) = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Aspiration = discharge of inspiratory impulses from the respiratory center in the medulla = radiation of these impulses to the nearby cardiac center = increased sympathetic discharge from this center to the heart = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Aspiration = inflation of the lung = stimulation of stretch receptors in smooth muscle of bronchioles = inhibitory impulses pass through the vagus to the cardio-inhibitory center in the medulla = decreased parasympathetic supply to the heart = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Aspiration = increased venous return to the right side of the heart but decreased venous return to the left side = decreased cardiac output from the left side.</li>
</ol>
<p>22
The text of medical technology® of science</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="appendix-eco">APPENDIX ECO<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#appendix-eco" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="special-areas-rhythm">Special areas rhythm<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#special-areas-rhythm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>The normal cardiac rhythm is a sinus rhythm (i.e. the pacemaker is the SA code).</li>
<li>Abnormal rhythms like nodal rhythm (pacemaker is AV node) or isoventricular rhythm (pacemaker is the ventricle) occur when the SA node is diseased or when there is complete block of conduction between atria and ventricles (3rd degree heart block).</li>
<li>Presence of normal P wave in the ECG indicates normal rhythm.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="sinus-arrhythmia">Sinus arrhythmia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sinus-arrhythmia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>This is a normal physiological condition in healthy children &amp; young adults. It depends on intact autonomic nervous system.</li>
<li>It is defined as change in heart rate with respiration (heart rate increases with expiration &amp; decreases with expiration). This variation in the heart rate is lost in patients with autonomic neuropathy.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="possible-explanations-for-the-sinus-arrhythmia">Possible explanations for the sinus arrhythmia:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#possible-explanations-for-the-sinus-arrhythmia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Aspiration = decreased intra-thoracic pressure = increased venous return = (aerologic reflex or effect (see below) = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Aspiration = discharge of inspiratory impulses from the respiratory center in the medulla = radiation of these impulses to the nearby cardiac center = increased sympathetic discharge from this center to the heart = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Aspiration = inflation of the lung = stimulation of stretch receptors in smooth muscle of bronchioles = inhibitory impulses pass through the vagus to the cardio-inhibitory center in the medulla = decreased parasympathetic supply to the heart = increased heart rate.</li>
<li>Aspiration = increased venous return to the right side of the heart but decreased venous return to the left side = decreased cardiac output from the left side.</li>
</ol>
<p>side = decreased blood pressure = less stimulation of baroreceptors = increased heart rate (read below).</p>
<p>Fig 6.12: variation in heart rate with respiration (silous arrhythmia)</p>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-012b2bdc.jpeg" alt="img-236.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="abnormal-sinus-rhythm">Abnormal sinus rhythm<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#abnormal-sinus-rhythm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="sinus-tachycardia">Sinus tachycardia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sinus-tachycardia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>The heart rate is fast (&gt; 100/min) while the pacemaker is still the SA node.</li>
<li>Causes may be physiological (e.g. coxime, pain, hypoglycemia and exercise) or pathological (e.g. hypothyroidism and drugs like beta adrenergic agonists and muscarinic blockers).</li>
</ul>
<p>Fig 6.11</p>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-35937ce0.jpeg" alt="img-237.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="sinus-bradycardia">Sinus bradycardia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sinus-bradycardia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>The heart rate is slow (&gt; 60/min) while the pacemaker is still the SA node.</li>
<li>Causes may be physiological (e.g. sleep and athletes) or pathological (e.g. hypothyroidism, hypothermia and drugs like beta blockers and muscarinic stimulators).</li>
</ul>
<p>214</p>
<p>The case of tachycardia/stress &gt; 60/min</p>
<p>side = decreased blood pressure = less stimulation of baroreceptors = increased heart rate (read below).</p>
<p>Fig 6.13: variation in heart rate with respiration (silous arrhythmia)</p>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-df3981f9.jpeg" alt="img-238.jpeg"></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="abnormal-sinus-rhythm">Abnormal sinus rhythm<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#abnormal-sinus-rhythm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="sinus-tachycardia">Sinus tachycardia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sinus-tachycardia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>

<li>The heart rate is slow (&gt; 60/min) while the pacemaker is still the SA node.</li>
<li>Causes may be physiological (e.g. sleep and athletes) or pathological (e.g. hypothyroidism, hypothermia and drugs like beta blockers and muscarinic stimulators).</li>
</ul>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="abnormal-sinus-rhythm">Abnormal sinus rhythm<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#abnormal-sinus-rhythm" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="sinus-tachycardia">Sinus tachycardia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sinus-tachycardia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>The heart rate is fast (&gt; 100/min) while the pacemaker is still the SA node.</li>
<li>Causes may be physiological (e.g. cocaine, pain, hypoglycemia and exercise) or pathological (e.g. hypothyroidism and drugs like beta adrenergic agonists and muscarinic blockers).</li>
</ul>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="sinus-bradycardia">Sinus bradycardia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sinus-bradycardia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
